dialogue.string: 1�I have heard of your valiant efforts from my son. It would not be an understatement to say that your repeated bravery has helped maintain peace throughout the Kingdom.
1�As for Lightbringer, as long as Rochefogne remains unconscious...

1�You do so much resemble your sister...Forgive me. We all thought you had perished during the Great War. If I had only known that you were the true Rochefogne, we might have been able to prevent the loss of so many lives.
1�You may rise, Rochefogne.As much as I would like to reminisce of times past, I first wish to know of Lightbringer.
1�However, the legend of Ranperre tells of how the Dragon King used Lightbringer to bring peace to San d'Oria. How could such an instrument of good bring so much evil?
1�I agree. And I have the perfect citizen to help carry out the task.
1� , you are well-versed in the layout of King Ranperre's Tomb. I ask you to travel there in advance and rid the area of any evil that could endanger the task at hand.
1�I have a feeling that the Orcs may pay us another unexpected visit.
1�Trion has spoken to me about you. At long last we meet,  . I commend you for putting an end to the Shadow Lord.
1�Of course, our nation has fallen ill. Our long struggle with the beastmen has prevented any recovery from the war.
1�Much like the reign of King Ranperre.
1�Yes, our great ancestor. But that king pulled our kingdom from the brink, and brought San d'Oria again to greatness.
1�Yes. The legends speak of King Ranperre and how he used the Treasure to save his nation.
1�Halver, it is most troublesome. There is something I must confer with you about.Nay, rather I have a request for you.
1�Ahem. Well, how do I begin?Do you recall the day when my beloved Leaute first came to the chateau?
1�This has nothing to do with Leaute.I wanted to speak with you about a new queen.
1�Hrmph. I thought perhaps it was time the subject was breached.
1�Yes, I do not doubt that Leaute has been uneasy in her eternal rest. Halver, I want you to search for a suitable lady to become the future Queen of San d'Oria.
1�Hmmm. Naturally, she must have a compassionate heart for all of our subjects, as did my dear Leaute.
1�It is said that men always look for the image of their mother, however...These things you should be asking of the lady's future husband. Finding out his preferences will be part of this task.
1�Haven't you been listening, Halver? We are speaking of Trion's bride-to-be!

1�Of course, it is yet to be decided whether or not Trion is to succeed me. However, it is a distinct possibility. It will be necessary to find Pieuje a bride as well, but for the moment I believe we should search for a fitting consort for Crown Prince Trion.
1�The only peculiar thing around here is you, Halver! In any case, I entrust you with the duty of finding Trion a suitable wife and arranging an introduction.
1�This need not be so difficult if Trion is merely made aware of the fact that he has approached a marriageable age.
1�Ahahaha! Halver, have you developed a sense of humor over the years?
1�I never thought you were the type to indulge in comedy. You must entertain us with your jests at the next banquet.
1�Now, as for Trion's preferences. This is quite a quandary, isn't it?
1�Of course, who would know better than his own brother? Well? Out with it then, Pieuje.
1�Hmm, things have certainly changed since my day. Mayhap this is the best choice for him.Halver, continue this discussion with Pieuje and seek out a girl that matches Trion's interests.
1�Pieuje, not a word of this to your brother. He will become obstinate if he finds that we have been having this discussion without his knowledge.
1�Ah,  !I am delighted to see you have shown interest in our fine exercise.
1�I can assume you have already been informed of the finer details of Conflict, can I not?

1�The three nations are finally at peace. Tension between the people of Vana'diel is the last thing any of us wish. However, while only a simple exercise, a game such as Ballista could be misinterpreted by some as a direct attack on an ally.

1�That is where you adventurers come in. Your minds are still clear, your spirits fresh. You are not controlled by petty politics and hidden agendas. It is you who have the opportunity to become the true heroes of the Kingdom.
1�Ah, but to think I would live to see the day Conflict was reinstated. Just thinking of the heated battle makes my heart race with excitement.
1�When I was still young, I would spend my days training for Ballista with my fellow knights. Victory was the only thing on our minds.
1�Knowing thy enemy and using that knowledge to strike him down...Giving your all till you have no more to give...The power of the spirit is what drives us, young  .
1�And when the battle is through, there remains no hate nor spite--only a bond between brothers that can be experienced through the silent, firm handshake exchanged before parting.
1�You have my permission to take part in the games.My only regret is that due to my age, I will be unable to fight by your side.
1�However, forget not during these exercises you will be bearing the emblem of the Kingdom. The honor of San d'Oria is at stake, so act accordingly.
1�Defeat is not an option. I expect you to do your best, and I expect you to win.
1�So you are the adventurer known as  . It has come to my attention that you wish to participate in our battle exercises.
1�Step closer and show me your face.

1�When I learned that adventurers from Bastok would be taking part in Conflict, I was looking forward to seeing what kind of brute warrior the Republic would send. But if this is all my Hume companions have to offer, I can be only more positive that the forces of San d'Oria will be victorious.
1�In recent years our two nations have been on amicable terms. However, I do not feel that any of my loyal citizens have forgotten what transpired in the Konschtat Highlands.

1�When I learned that adventurers from Windurst would be taking part in Conflict, I was looking forward to seeing what kind of mighty sorcerer the Federation would send. But if this is all my Tarutaru companions have to offer, I can be only more positive that the forces of San d'Oria will be victorious.
1�In recent years San d'Oria and Windurst have been on amicable terms. However, I do not feel that any of my loyal citizens have forgotten the bitter history that stains our nations' past.

1�Ballista is the perfect opportunity to help erase the unwanted feelings of spite between us. But this does not mean my Kingdom's forces will show pity to their opponents. I will grant you the opportunity to withdraw your participation, if you wish.
1�...I see that you have already made up your mind.
1�Understood.Speak with Excenmille in Northern San d'Oria. There you will receive your Conflict registration.
1�You may have had success in previous battles, but the road that lies ahead is like nothing you have traveled before. Clear your heart and cast off all inhibitions, and you will go far.
1�I wish you and your nation luck,  .
1�I have heard good things about you,  . Your contributions to the Kingdom are both welcomed and appreciated.
1�I assume you have heard the details from Halver. Your next mission is a request left by my late wife, Leaute, in her will.
1�You've visited the garden where the queen rests, have you not?
1�In that garden grows a rare, delicate flower, found only in certain remote areas of Vana'diel. My wife asked in her will that this flower, the 3????, always bloom by her side.
1�It sounds like a simple task, but the rarity of the seeds forces us to send out our finest warriors.
1�That is why I have called you here,  . I can trust you will find 6???? and plant it in the garden alongside my dear wife's grave.
1�Welcome back from your long journey,  . I am pleased to report that Curilla's forces located the holy sword, Lightbringer.
1�According to the writings in our ancient tomes, the scholars feel that the retrieved sword is truly the lost Treasure of the Dragon King.
1�The path leading to this day has been long and treacherous. However, our journey is nearly complete. I do not have the words to express my gratitude for your services.
1�I thank you, and wish that you might continue your work for the good of San d'Oria long after I have stepped down from the throne.
1�However, one final ceremony must be held--the true heir to the House of d'Oraguille must be decided. At that time, your service will again be called upon.
1�Welcome,  . I am Destin, King of San d'Oria.
1�Please, be at ease. I've heard of you from Claidie. Much have you done for the Kingdom, it seems!
1�An iron giant with the power to smite an airship from the sky, and a young Empress who would nonetheless seek to restore its power...
1�I would hear your counsel, Halver.
1�Very well.
1�Halver and my sons present a compelling case.Return to this Empress, and tell her San d'Oria stands with her.Now farewell, and may the Goddess watch over your journey!
1�An iron giant with the power to smite an airship from the sky, and a young Empress who would nonetheless seek to restore its power...
1�I would hear your counsel, Halver.
1�Very well.
1�Halver and my son present a compelling case.Return to this Empress, and tell her San d'Oria stands with her.Now farewell, and may the Goddess watch over your journey!
1�I know that your bodies still ache from our recent encounter with the Orcs.
1�However, I require your utmost attention, for I have an important announcement.

1�I have decided that it is in the best interest of the Kingdom to prolong the Rites of Succession indefinitely. My sons still have much to learn of ruling a kingdom. Furthermore, when the time comes for me to step down, if I find my sons inadequate, I will not hesitate in selecting an heir from outside the d'Oraguille family.

1�It is not only the royal family, but others like  , that have silently supported San d'Oria for the past twenty years. Perhaps it is an adventurer such as ?[he/she] that would be best suited for the throne.
1�The arrogance of the Elvaan has held back this country for much too long. From today forth, we shall recognize our fellow races and join hands with them to form a stronger, better kingdom.
1�We can hold our heads high knowing that there are adventurers such as  , willing to risk their lives for the good of the Kingdom.
1�I see you have all arrived. Now all we have is to wait for Claidie.
1�Ah, how is he? How is Rochefogne?
1�I see... Then we must wait until we may ask any more questions.However, I have just learned that the role of Lightbringer in the Rites of Succession was conceived by the papsque himself...
1�He lied to us about the true inscription on the stone tablet. The true inscription speaks of how the sword must be protected at all times and must never be drawn.
1�The papsque had come to believe that Lightbringer was the key to the Gates of Paradise. It seems as if the Archduke of Jeuno's brother, Eald'narche, led him to believe this...
1�Because the sword can only be drawn by a member of the royal family, His Holiness conceived the Rites of Succession.
1�We shall never know the full extent of the papsque's ambition, but just like us, he was lured by the awesome power that Lightbringer harbors in its blade.
1�Whatever the case, we cannot afford to let the beastmen attempt to use it, even if it takes the dispatch of every last soldier in San d'Oria.
1�Curb your conceit, Trion!
1�Trion, you are simply dancing on the stage of destiny. It is time for you to come down and face reality.
1�I will command the army.
1�Trion, you will stand on the front lines and show the knights the true honor and valor of the d'Oraguille family.
1�Pieuje, you will maintain the supply routes, providing constant support to the front line and your brother.
1�Claidie, you will tend to Rochefogne, as well as watch over him. He has yet to win my trust.
1� , after this display, you must think the royal family pitiful. However, I have one last request of you. I wish you to stand on the front lines with Trion.
1�And finally, we must not forget that we must be faithful to the citizens of this kingdom. We stand on the foundation they built. We must not lose their trust.
1�Good work. Tell the scout to rest from his journey.
1�Yes, Trion.Oh, I see the discoverer of the ancient tome is also here with us.
1�Well, as you all expected, the tomb discovered is in fact the true resting place of the Dragon King. I applaud our adventurer on ?[his/her] work.
1�In addition to this, the ancient writings also tell us about King Ranperre's Treasure...
1�According to the encrypted tome, the Treasure is a sword--a sword that, when unsheathed, wields more power than one can imagine. ??Lightbringer.??
1�Unfortunately, the whereabouts of the sword were not found within the tome's pages. However, our investigation has taken an important step forward.
1� . If you obtain any new information on Lightbringer, I ask you to share it with us.
1�While finding Ranperre's holy sword is one of our top priorities, paying proper homage to our former king is something I wish to do as successor to his throne.
1� . I wish for you to travel to the Dragon King's tomb and purge the area of any vermin. We will follow directly behind.
1�Hmph. If only we knew! This is all but legend, but apparently the king sealed it away somewhere. I cannot fathom why.
1�Many were sent looking for it, but none succeeded. Perhaps now is the time we must find it and break the barrier that protects it.
1� , should you uncover any news of Ranperre's Treasure, report to us at once.
1�Now just a moment, Trion. Why should we wander in darkness when the papsque may still illuminate us?
1�Yes. I have faith that soon he will find some clue for us.
1�My own life is waning. I must solve this mystery while I still breathe!
1�When that time comes,  , your assistance will be needed by us all. Do not let us down!
1�That is all for today. Go and rest, for soon enough we may call upon you again.
1�Call forth all members of the court. Has the adventurer   arrived?
1�Ah,  . The deciphering of the stone tablet you found has been completed.
1�There is one line that has us especially intrigued...
1�??Light will befall the great Vana'diel only when the true heir of d'Oraguille raises Lightbringer to the heavens.??
1�Then it is decided. When we have possession of the legendary sword, Trion and Pieuje will both attempt to unsheathe it.
1�Whoever succeeds will take my place on the throne as the true heir to the House of d'Oraguille.
1�Trion or Pieuje--the sword will decide the future of San d'Oria and lead us from the darkness. Of course, we must first locate the Treasure of the Dragon King.
1�Rahal. Curilla.I want your knights to concentrate their efforts on locating Lightbringer.
1�And  .Report to Rahal for your orders. I trust that your involvement in this investigation can only benefit San d'Oria.
1�Set forth and search the darkness for the light that will guide us to a brighter future. The dawn of a new era in San d'Oria is upon us!
1�Curilla? Are you there?
1�Ah, very good. Your leadership was exemplary, as always. Thanks to you, I may focus on my duties.
1�However, Curilla, there seems to be something you overlooked.
1�During the uproar, somebody made off with the talisman!
1�The very one. We were visited by an infiltrator while our eyes were on the brigands.
1�I suspected them so.
1�But before we track down this infiltrator, first must we thwart their sinister plot. Halver, let us decide on a plan of action.
1�Curilla, be not disheartened; by no means was this your fault. Call off the alert, and return to your regular duties.
1�Well,  , your help is needed yet again. Halver will convey my orders soon enough... Remember, you have our thanks!
1�As I'm sure Lord Halver has told you, we decided to appoint you to serve in the Embassy of San d'Oria at Jeuno.
1�Recently we lost one of our staff there. But do not be alarmed, for you shall serve under my direct appointment.
1�Take that letter of introduction with you and depart for Jeuno.
1�The embassy has been informed, and is expecting you. Show the letter to any of the staff there.
1�Depart as soon as you are able.
1�Safe journeys,  .4
1� , you have my gratitude for saving my life in the Qu'Bia Arena.

1�The Royal Knights have driven the Orcs into a corner. Our conflict with fiends will soon be resolved. As much as I wish to stand on the frontline with my fellow soldiers, I have many new responsibilities to face here in the chateau.
1�I may, once again, require your services. Until then, may the Goddess shine Her glory upon you in your travels.
1�So the ceremony was a farce...?
1�Then what...is Lightbringer?
1�Father, let me take command of the army.
1�I am to blame for the loss of Lightbringer. The responsibility of retrieving it lies within me.

1�I was the one who ignored Claidie's pleas to attempt negotiations with Rochefogne. If it were not for my foolish pride, none of this would ever have been brought upon San d'Oria!Father! Allow me the chance to redeem myself!
1�Father...!?
1�Father...
1�Well done,  .Do you wish to know what is written in the tome? The king is about to make an official announcement regarding its contents in the Great Hall.
1�Father. Shall we begin?
1�The Dragon King's...4
1�Long have we awaited your arrival,  . Your assistance is required in a mission for the Kingdom.
1�Where is the king, you ask? His Highness has retired to his quarters for the day. Recently, he has not been in the best of health.

1�There is no need to be concerned with my father's condition. Now that Lightbringer has found its way back to San d'Oria, the king has begun to show great improvement. He should be back to his normal self within days.
1�Now as for the reason you were summoned here: the papsque has called upon you to perform an investigation. His Holiness should be here shortly.
1�A magical wall, you say?
1�Rochefogne...That scoundrel is up to something.
1�Ah, and this is why you have requested the assistance of the adventurer  .
1�Your Holiness, it sounds as if you are quite skilled at burying things...
1�Yes.Well,   is one of San d'Oria's finest adventurers. I am certain that ?[he/she] will locate the mediums and succeed in destroying them.

1�With that Rochefogne running about, we will be forced to postpone the Rites of Succession. We would not want another scene like at the coming-of-age ceremony. We have our father's health to think about.
1�Claidie!You know quite well that you are not allowed to interfere with these meetings.
1�Hah. I apologize, Claidie.Well, as long as you are present, let us hear your opinion on the situation at hand.
1�That is, if you believe the scoundrel.
1�Watch what you say, Claidie. Not all of us here are of the royal family.

1�However, that decision was an important turning point in the war. The gallant battle waged by the citizens of Tavnazia dealt a forceful blow to the beastman forces and gave us enough time to prepare our armies.
1�Tavnazia was destroyed when the beastmen's secret weapon malfunctioned. Nothing, not even the beastmen themselves, were left after that calamity.
1�And that is why we must first capture him. Only then will we be able to clear up that which troubles our two sides.
1�Hah. I will heed your wish. However, if he lays a hand on any of my knights, I will be forced to take action.
1� , search out and destroy these ??mediums?? that the papsque mentioned earlier. Only by doing so will the Kingdom be safe from the treachery behind this fiendish plan.
1�The ??Cadavres des Corneilles??! Pieuje, are you mad!?
1�Hmmm...Then do as you wish.
1�You have fulfilled my expectations. No, you surpassed them! For that we thank you. May you continue to serve the motherland.
1�Hmph. Ever the complainer, I see.
1�Father, let us not dwell on the petty details! The Shadow Lord is dead, and our greatest threat is no more. We must return our attention to San d'Oria herself.
1�You speak of the Treasure of the Dragon King?
1�Father, I urge you to send expeditions to every corner of Vana'diel!
1�As my father stated, you may be more suited than I to rule our kingdom...
1�However, whether or not I ever stand at the pinnacle of San d'Oria is not important. This situation with Rochefogne, Lightbringer, and the Orcs has taught me much of what I lack as a leader.
1�Far too often I have relied on your bravery and loyalty. If it were not for your gallant actions, I would have surely perished in the Northlands.
1�If your journeys ever bring you back here to San d'Oria, you will always be welcome. Not as an adventurer, but as a friend.
1�Thanks to your perseverance and commitment to the Kingdom, Lightbringer has been found, and now the Rites of Succession can be carried out.
1�As long as the Treasure is in San d'Oria, the Kingdom will be safe--regardless of whether myself or my brother is the true heir to the throne.
1�The Rites of Succession will be carried out soon. At that time, your services will once again be called upon.
1�So, my younger sister has finally come of age... I remember when my brother and I would sneak out of the chateau and search the city for presents to buy her.
1�We would always be awed by the wonders of the city.
1�One year, the king caught us sneaking out. Our mother tried talking to our father, but there was no easing his anger. It was then that I first feared my father.
1�Our mother fell ill shortly after, and there was nothing my brother or I could do to save her. Maybe it was our lack of power to save our mother that made us enemies...
1�I apologize for my rambling. Perhaps I should journey out into the city and select my sister's gift...
1�Hm? Oh, it's you, Halver. So rare to see you in this part of the chateau. Is there something that needs my attention?
1�A lady...? You mean a new guard for the courtyard, or some such?
1�She appears to be an adventurer...?
1�My preferences?Halver, what in blazes are you talking about?
1�So this is Father's doing...I do not recall speaking of my ??preferences?? to anyone, however...
1�C-Curilla...?What are you doing here?
1�Halver...
1�Remove yourself from my presence right this minute, or your blood will stain my fist!
1�Our father is feeling much better now. He should be returning to his proper position on the throne shortly.
1�The Rites of Succession are upon us. When the time comes, we will be once again calling upon your services.You are dismissed.
1�Pieuje, what has become of our younger sister?
1�Hmmm...She must realize that what we are doing is for the good of the Kingdom.
1�What is it that troubles you, Pieuje?
1�Hah hah hah!Your petty worries and niggling prudence amuse me, Brother.
1�Your mission is to seek out the true tomb of King Ranperre. Finding the location of the tomb is critical in boosting the Kingdom's morale.
1�So it was you the guard sent...No matter. Your mission this time deals with the Treasure of the Dragon King.
1�Our royal scholars have brought to light the fact that the Treasure may be hidden in the true tomb of King Ranperre.
1�As you may have already realized, the current tomb is a new one, built many years after the king passed away.
1�The location of the true tomb was lost during the Great War. This loss has haunted San d'Oria for the past twenty years.
1�Finding the location of the true tomb is critical in locating the lost Treasure, as well as in boosting the Kingdom's morale.
1�Your mission is to seek out the true tomb of King Ranperre. I can trust that you will not deface the tomb when you find it.
1�What is it?
1�What? Boots from the mouth of a fish?
1�Yes, those are issued to our knights. The soles are inscribed with the name of their owner. Yes, here it is engraved: ??Chusarlaud.??
1�Hmm... Fetch me Vilbert.
1�I recall you were familiar with Chusarlaud before his disappearance. I asked you before, but can you remember anything new?
1�I am afraid not, Vilbert. Thank you, that is all.
1�Keep this secret, but a year ago I believed Orcs were aware of the inner workings of this court.
1�I suspected Chusarlaud was their spy, even more so after his disappearance. I never thought him dead.
1�I seek an appropriate candidate to look into this, preferably a knight. I would have asked you if only... Oh, never mind.
1�I thank you for delivering this. Here is your reward,  $????.
1�What? You've solved the mystery! Quickly, tell me everything.
1�I see. Earlier, Exoroche requested an audience. His achievements deserve praise indeed!
1�Gather all knights of his division!
1�Exoroche, in recognition for your valor in the service of the Royal Knights, I award you this #????.
1�Commendable words! O paragon of San d'Orian virtue, may you fulfill our considerable expectations!
1�Name it.
1�So be it. Come forth to receive the #????,  , in recognition of your glorious service to our order. You have my personal thanks as well.
1�Ailbeche, young lad, your father is a great knight. May you grow as strong as him.
1�Keep this secret, but a year ago I believed Orcs were aware of the inner workings of this court.
1�I suspected Chusarlaud was their spy, even more so after his disappearance. I never thought him dead.
1�Would you hearken after his disappearance? This matter requires the objectivity of an outsider.
1�Remember, speak not a word of this to the knights! Chusarlaud once dwelt in Southern San d'Oria, so there you should begin your search.
1�Very well, report to me once you know more.
1�Is that so? Well, I know you shoulder other responsibilities as well. But hear this: There are none else in whom I could entrust this task. Return hither whenever you are able to serve us.
1�Remember, Chusarlaud once dwelt in Southern San d'Oria, so begin your search there. And speak not a word to the knights!
1�And this means...
1�The true...heir?
1�Are you there, Curilla?
1�Oh, a guest. What is all this?
1�What, you have a set of greaves that refuses to be worn? I've heard of that sort of thing before. Yes, they had to be taken to the Crawlers' Nest to be exorcised.
1�I am sorry, Curilla, but you are summoned for service. The papsque has complained that the regions surrounding San d'Oria are patrolled too thinly. We must think of a plan.
1�I shall await you in my chambers. This is no time to tread through crawlers' lairs, mind you!
1�Political maneuvering, you call it? To think our nation could become this cesspool of manipulation and intrigue...
1�We have no time for these antics! If they truly are plotting to raise the Shadow Lord, we have not a moment to lose!
1�Are such words even necessary?
1�Before they hit us, let us hit them. A bold strike would hamper their momentum.
1�Liability!? Fools! Are you all blind to this peril? The enemy approaches while we bicker!
1�Curilla, do you share the opinion of Halver and Rahal?
1�Hmph. So be it! All this talk of diplomatic liability... There are people we must defend, and an enemy we must defeat. Naught matters but that simple truth!
1�In such times, where could Pieuje be going?
1�How long do these fools wish to sit here discussing our deaths? We've no time for talk, not anymore.
1�We must move to stop the return of the Shadow Lord, or war will come upon Vana'diel once again.
1� , this is an order! Hurry as quickly as you can to Castle Zvahl in the far north, and put an end to this evil scheme of the beastmen!
1�I will accept all responsibility for this mission. Now, go, brave warrior! For the future of Vana'diel!
1�What foolishness is this? I have done nothing wrong!
1�Think of some way to defeat the beastmen, if you've time to worry over me!
1� ! Many are those who speak of your triumphs in the name of San d'Oria!
1�The Royal Knights have but a single purpose: to exterminate the Orcs who ravage our lands!
1�No, but wait... This matter requires more than Royal Knights... Confound it! We need Temple Knights as well!
1�Halver...!
